question: Who can see Employee’s data in TalenTicks?
answer: TalenTicks is a highly secure HR software platform with advanced data security. The role-based access feature of the platform allows only HR/ Admin to view, edit Employee’s specific information. This ensures the data is protected from unauthorized access and prevents data misuse.

question: How HR/ Admin can inform the entire organisation about upcoming events?
answer: HR can inform about upcoming events through BUZZBOOK menu. Click on the News & Announcements tab in BUZZBOOK menu and enter the event details you want to share with the Organisation. You can also attach any image if required. Then Click on Share button to share it. It will be notified to all the Employee’s via Notification.

question: How to add new Joinee data into TalenTicks?
answer:
TalenTicks allows both Single and Bulk Employee Entry. For Single employee Entry, click on the Employee Management menu and then click on the Add Employee tab. Fill in all the mandatory marked fields information and click on Submit button. 
Employee will get added into the TalenTicks.

For Bulk Employee upload, click on the Bulk Uploader Menu and from Employee upload Tab, download Excel format. Fill all the information and upload the file from the same tab. Added Employee can be viewed in View Employee tab in Employee Management.

question: As an HR, can I view and edit Employee’s details?
answer:
Yes, click on the Employee Management Menu then click on the View Employee tab. Search the employee you are looking for, using the given Filters and click on the employee code to view the details. Click on the Edit button available below. Edit the data and click on Submit Button. Data will get updated.

Or, Search Employee and Click on the Hamburger lines available next to employee code and click on Edit & View. Click on the Edit button available below. Edit the data and click on Submit Button. Data will get updated.

question: How to assign Special Leave to an Employee?
answer:
Click on Apply Employee Leave submenu of Leave & Attendance menu. Select the Leave Type from the dropdown, Choose the employee for which you want to mark this Leave, mention the date range of the leave with the reason and click on Submit to submit it.

Special Leave are the Leave that can be assigned by an HR only. Employee will be visible in Special Leave Dropdown only when the Special Leave Type is assigned to an Employee. Search Employee in Employee Management, edit Employee and Select Special Leave Type from Dropdown and Submit. To Assign Special Leave, click on Apply Employee Leave in Leave & Attendance menu. In All Leave Section, Select Leave Type, Employee name, From and To Date with Reason. Click on Apply Leave to add leave. Added Leave details can be viewed in below data table.

question: Does TalenTicks allow to mark LWP for the whole month?
answer: Yes, Click on the Employee Management menu and click on the view Employee tab. Search the Employee using filters and click on the hamburger lines available next to Employee Code. Click on Mark All Days LWP to mark LWP for the whole month. All Days LWP will also make whole month attendance status as Leave (LWP).

question: How to put Salary of an Employee on Hold?
answer: Click on Employee Management menu from the Side bar and click on View Employee tab then Search Employee using the given filters. Click on the hamburger lines available next to employee code and click on Hold Salary. After this enter the reason for holding salary in the popup page and click on Submit button. Hold Salary Employee will be visible in the UNPROCESSED PAYROLL list during Payroll.

question: How to Unhold the Salary of an Employee?
answer: Click on Employee Management menu present in the Sidebar and click on the View Employee tab then Search Employee using the given filters. Click on the hamburger lines next to employee code and click on Unhold Salary to Unhold the Salary of an Employee.

question: As an HR, how can I check Employee's Salary Details?
answer: Click on the View Employee Tab under the Employee Management menu and Search Employee using the given filters. Click on Hamburger lines available next to employee code and click on Salary Details to view the Salary Details.

question: How to add Adhoc Arrear Days for an Employee?
answer: Click on the Employee Management menu, and then on the view employee tab, search for the employee using the given filters. Click on the hamburger lines available next to employee code and click on Adhoc Arrear Days. Here the Employee code and the Employee name will be auto-populated. Then select the month of which the arrear is and the month on which the arrears has to be given and select the Year, Adhoc dates from the drop-down and also choose whether it is for full day or half day, enter reason and click on Submit. The Attendance for the Adhoc Dates will be marked as Present and can be viewed in Attendance menu.

question: How can I add Mediclaim Amount for an employee?
answer: Click on Employee Management and then on View employee tab. Search Employee using the filters available. Click on the hamburger line available next to employee code and click on Set Mediclaim Amount. A popup for Set Mediclaim Amount will get open. Employee name will be auto populated. Enter the Mediclaim amount (Mediclaim amount should be yearly amount) and Select Effective date. Click on submit. The Mediclaim amount will get reflected in Salary Structure.

question: How can I edit the Salary Structure’s Component Amount?
answer: Click on the Employee Management menu and Search the Employee in the View Employee Tab using the filters. Click on hamburger line available next to employee code and click on Salary Details. Employee’s Salary Structure will get open. The Edit Symbol is present only for the current salary structure.  Edit the Amount and click on Submit.  Based on the amount changes, Annual Gross and CTC automatically gets changed.

question: How can I reset the employee’s password?
answer: Click on the Employee Management menu and Search Employee in View Employee tab and click on hamburger lines and click on Reset Password. Employee Code and Name will be auto- populated. Enter new password in the new password field and re-enter the same password in the confirm password field to confirm it and click on Submit. Provide the New password to Employee.

question: How can I Terminate an Employee in TalenTicks? What Process needs to be followed to terminate an Employee?
answer: Click on the Employee Management menu and Search Employee in the View Employee tab then click on the hamburger lines and click on Terminate/ Abscond Employee.  Select the Deactivation Type whether the employee has been terminated or absconded from the Organisation, also fill in the reason for it. Click on Submit. The Terminated/ Absconded Employees can be viewed in the Terminated/Resigned Employees tab in Employee Management.

question: How to update PF and ESIC Details?
answer:
Click on the Employee Management menu and click on the PF and ESI Tab. Search the employee using the filter and click on the hamburger lines then click on Edit & View option to add it.

If you want to enter the data for Provident Fund then click on Yes present just below the Provident Fund field and if the employee is eligible for Employee State Insurance, then select Yes from the drop-down and enter the ESI number. After filling in all the details click on Save to save the data. 
o	(Employee Name and Employee code are non-Editable. If the PF is No and want to Enable PF, click on Yes and Enter PF Details. If PF is Yes and want to edit, edit details. PF Percentage can be changed to 1800 or 12%. If ESI is No and want to enable, select yes, enter ESI No. and save the Data.

PF and ESIC Data can also be updated via Bulk Upload Sheet. Download the PF and ESIC Sheet from the Bulk Uploaders menu. Enter only those data that needs to be updated and keep rest of the sheet blank. Save the sheet and upload. After upload, data can be viewed in PF & ESIC Tab in Employee Management.

question: How can I update Bank Details for an employee?
answer: Click on the Employee Management menu and click on Bank A/C details tab. Search the employee using filter then click on the hamburger lines and click on Edit & View to add the details. Fill in all the mandatory details and click on Update. Bank Details can also be updated via Bulk Upload Sheet. Download the Bank Sheet from the Bulk Uploaders menu. Enter only those data that needs to be updated and keep rest of the sheet blank. Save the sheet and upload. After upload, data can be viewed in Bank Details Tab in Employee Management.

question: Where can I see Exit/Terminated Employees Data in TalenTicks?
answer: Click on the Employee Management menu present in the sidebar and click on Terminated/Resigned Employees. Scroll down to see the details of all employees and you can also search an employee using filters.

question: How can I see the Payslips of Exited Employees?
answer: Click on the Employee Management menu present in the sidebar and Search employee in the Terminated/Resigned Employees tab.  Click on the Hamburger lines then click on Payslips. You can see it by single download just by clicking on the download button in the Action column or bulk download by selecting multiple check box in the Select all column and then click on Bulk Download Option

question: How can I get the Salary Details of Exited Employee?
answer:
Click on the Employee Management menu present in the sidebar and search the employee in Terminated/Resigned Employees tab and click on the hamburger lines then click on Salary details. The salary structure of that employee will be displayed.

(Employee Management Terminated/ Resigned Employees Tab? Search employee and click on Hamburger button? Click on Salary Details)

question: From where I can see the Grade and Band Details of the Employees?
answer: Click on the Employee Management menu present in the sidebar and Search the Employee in the View Employee tab using the filters and click on the hamburger lines and click on Salary Details. Grade and Bands and other details are mentioned below the current Salary Structure.

question: Can I create a Different Shift other than the Regular Shift?
answer: Yes, In Shift menu, click on Create Shift submenu and then click on Create Shift Time present on the top. Add New Time Block popup will get open. Mention the New shift name, check in and check out time, break time, half day and full day hours (Full day working hrs should be inclusive of break time). Click on Add new Time Block to create a Different Shift other than the Regular Shift. Created Shift will be visible in the Shift dropdown in Assign Shift.

question: How to assign a shift to an Employee?
answer: In Shift menu, click on the Create Shift submenu and click on Assign Shift present on the top. Select the date and the shift from the dropdown. The start time, end time, break time, half-day and full-day hours will be auto-populated as you have already mentioned it in while creating the shift. Select whether to repeat this shift or not. Select the Branch and based on the branch an employee list will get displayed. Click on Add to Schedule button.

question: How can I check the assigned shifts of an Employee?
answer: Click on the Shifts menu and then on the Create Shift submenu. A current month calendar will be visible on this page. Months can be moved back and forth with the help of allows available.  Here you can see the employee names in every date block for which the shift is assigned and if hover over them, it will show the assigned shift time. And if many employees are with shifts other than general shifts then you can view all the employees name by click on the plus (+) icon.

question: What should I do if the Shift for an Employee Changes? How to assign new shift to an Employee? Or What should be done to change the shift of an Employee?
answer: Assign new shifts to the Employee and to do this In Shift menu click on the Create Shift submenu and click on Assign Shift present on the top . Select the date and the shift from the dropdown. The start time, end time, break time, half-day and full-day hours will be auto-populated as you have already assigned it in while creating the shift. Select whether to repeat this shift or not. Select the employee for which you want to add this shift after selecting the branch in which the employee works. The New Shift will be reflected from the Date you have mentioned.

question: Can I do the bulk upload of the new joinee details into the system?
answer: Yes, click on the bulk uploader present in the sidebar. Click on the Employee Upload tab, Download Excel Format for employee bulk upload. Fill in all the mandatory marked employee details according to the Excel Sheet format and upload it using the upload file option. Then click on Upload to view all the data you are uploading in a view mode and if you feel all the given data is correct, click on Upload to upload it.

question: What should I do if I wanted to change particular fields for all employees?
answer: Click on the bulk uploader present in the sidebar. Click on the Employee Upload tab, Download Excel Format for employee bulk upload. Enter the data that you wanted to update and keep the rest of the data blank and upload the sheet using the Upload file option in the same tab. Then click on Upload and view all the data you are uploading in a view mode and if you feel all the given data is correct, click on Upload to upload or click on cancel button, to make changes in the file and again upload it.

question: How can I bulk upload, employee's PF, ESIC and Bank Details into the system?
answer: Click on the bulk uploader present in the sidebar. Click on the PF/ESIC/BANK Upload tab and download the Excel Format for PF/ESIC/BANK bulk upload. Fill in all the details according to the Excel Sheet format and upload it using the upload file option. Then click on Upload to view all the data you are uploading in a view mode and if you feel all the given data is correct, click on Upload to upload it.

question: What should I do if I wanted to change only particular field for all employees PF, ESIC and Bank Details data?
answer: Click on the bulk uploader present in the sidebar. Click on the PF/ESIC/BANK Upload tab, Download Excel Format for PF/ESIC/BANK bulk upload. Enter the data that you want to update and keep the rest of the data blank and upload the sheet using the Upload file option. Then click on Upload to view all the data you are uploading in a view mode and if you feel all the given data is correct, click on Upload to upload it.

question: How to Upload Attendance for Employee’s? /How can I add attendance of an Employee?
answer: Click on the bulk uploader present in the sidebar. Click on the Attendance Upload tab, Download Excel Format for attendance bulk upload. Fill in all the attendance details like date in the mentioned format and the Employee code in the Excel Sheet, mention in time and Out time and upload it using the upload file option. Then click on Upload, you will view all the data you are uploading in a view mode and if you feel all the given data is correct, click on Upload to upload it.

question: What should I do to make an employee attendance status as absent?
answer: Click on the bulk uploader menu present in the sidebar. Click on the Attendance Upload tab, Download Excel Format for attendance bulk upload. Fill in all the attendance details like Employee code and the date for which you want to make attendance as absent into the Excel Sheet and keep In Time and Out Time blank in the Excel Sheet to make an employee attendance status as absent and upload it using the upload file option. Then click on Upload, to view all the data you are uploading in a view mode and if you feel all the given data is correct, click on Upload to upload it.

question: How to upload the leaves on behalf of Employees?
answer: Click on the bulk uploader present in the sidebar. Click on the Leave Upload tab, Download Excel Format for leave bulk upload. Fill in all the leave details like Employee code, leave type and Half day or full day as mentioned in the Excel Sheet format and upload it using the upload file option. Then click on Upload, to view all the data you are uploading in a view mode and if you feel all the given data is correct, click on Upload to upload it. Leave type Name should be exact same as mentioned in leave rules.

question: How to add Flexi Saturday Week offs for an Employee?
answer: Click on the bulk uploader present in the sidebar. Click on the Off Day Upload tab, Download Excel Format for off-day bulk upload. Fill in all the details like Off day as mentioned in download format, Employee code and month into the Excel Sheet format and upload it using the upload file option. Then click on Upload, to view all the data you are uploading in a view mode and if you feel all the given data is correct, click on Upload to upload it. Note: - For Each Month, there should be only one record for Each Employee Code.

question: What should I do if I upload incorrect Week off data?
answer:
Click on the bulk uploader present in the sidebar. Click on the Off Day Upload tab, Download Excel Format for off-day bulk upload. Fill in all the correct off-day, Employee code and month details according to the Excel Sheet format and re-upload it using the same upload file option. Then click on Upload, to view all the data you are uploading in a view mode and if you feel all the given data is correct, click on Upload to upload it.
The system will overwrite the data with the new one.
(In this case we need to reupload the Week in the same process with the correct data.

question: How can I Bulk Upload Salary for many employees?
answer: Click on the bulk uploader present in the sidebar. Click on the Salary Upload tab, Download Excel Format for Salary bulk upload. Fill in all the salary details in a pipeline structure with the annual values according to the Excel Sheet format and upload it using the upload file option. Then click on Upload, to view all the data you are uploading in a view mode and if you feel all the given data is correct, click on Upload to upload it.

question: How can I give additional amounts to employees other than Salary Structure?
answer: This can be done through Issuance. Click on the bulk uploader present in the sidebar. Click on the Issuance Upload tab, Download Excel Format for issuance bulk upload. Fill in all the issuance details like Employee Code, Payment Type, Component ID, Amount, Year, is Reimbursement or deduction according to the Excel Sheet format and upload it using the upload file option. Then click on Upload, to view all the data you are uploading in a view mode and if you feel all the given data is correct, click on Upload to upload it. Uploaded Issuance data can be viewed by clicking on the issuance in the Payroll Menu. View the Issuance data in the Issuance Entries data table. You can also search using Employee Code.

question: How to Upload/Create new Policies? /How to add new Policy?
answer: Click on the Onboarding menu present in the sidebar, click on the Create Policy submenu. Then click on the Create Policies tab to create new policy. Mention the Policy Name and select the policy type (created in Policy Master) , company and work type for which this is created. Enter the description and upload the policy as pdf file format. Click on Create to create the new policy. Click on View Policy Tab and Activate the Policy.

question: How can I view all the uploaded/created Policies?
answer: Click on the Onboarding menu present in the sidebar and click on the Create Policy submenu. Click on the View Policies tab, where all the uploaded/created Policies with their status will be visible and click on Edit option to view the policy in details.

question: How can I edit and update already uploaded and Active policies?
answer: Click on the Onboarding menu present in the sidebar and click on the Create Policy submenu. In View Policies tab, all the uploaded/created Policies with their status will be viewed. Click on the edit icon present before the policy name you want to edit it. Make all the changes in the data you want to update in Edit Policy Page and click on Update button to update the policy.

question: How can I create different Policies for different Companies?
answer: Click on the Onboarding menu present in the sidebar and click on the Create Policy submenu. Then click on the Create Policies tab to create new policy. Mention the Policy Name and select the policy type, Select Company and Select work type for which this is created. Enter the description and upload the policy as pdf file format. Click on Create to create the new policy.

question: What should I do if I what to create a policy same for all Company and Work Type?
answer: Click on the Onboarding menu present in the sidebar and click on the Create Policy submenu. Then click on the Create Policies tab to create new policy. Mention the Policy Name and select the policy type, Keep Company and work type field blank to consider it as “All”. Enter the description and upload the policy as pdf file format. Click on Create to create the new policy. In View Policy Section you can view Created Policy in Detail.

question: Can I create the new policy and make it Active at any time in the system?
answer: Yes. Just Follow the same process of Create Policy. It will be visible to Employees only when it will be made Active.

question: Why the Employee is unable to access any of the menus in TalenTicks even after the successful login?
answer: After filling in all the profile details, an employee has to accept the company policy. Without accepting the company policies, Employee cannot access any of the available menus.

question: How to check all the documents uploaded by Employee?
answer: Click on Onboarding menu and then on Employee Onboarding.  In pending on-boarding tab, search the employee using the filter. Click on Proceed button and then on the Upload Files Tab to view all the documents uploaded by Employee. Uploaded Documents will be notified in Green Tick and Pending Documents using cross icon.

question: How to check whether the Policies are accepted by an employee or not?
answer: Click on the Onboarding menu and click on Employee Onboarding. Click on the pending on-boarding tab and search the employee using the filter. You can see the policy acceptance status in the On-boarding status column or you can also check by clicking on the Proceed button and then by clicking on policies tab to get a detailed information of accepted policy in Accepted on Column.

question: Where can I view all the On-boarded Employees?
answer: Click on the Onboarding menu and click on Employee Onboarding. Click on the View On-boarded tab to view all the On-boarded Employees. You can also search for an Employee using Search option available.

question: How to Confirm Employees?
answer: Click on the Onboarding menu and then on Employee Onboarding. Click on the Confirm Employees tab and search employee using the search option available. Click on confirm button and enter the Date of Confirmation Click on Confirm button to save the record.

question: What should I do to extend the probation period of an employee?
answer: Click on the Onboarding menu and then on Employee Onboarding. Click on the Confirm Employees tab, search employee and click on the Extend Probation button. Enter the months to be extended and reason in the comments for extend in probation.

question: How to notify Employees on their Confirmation?
answer: When an Employee’s get confirmed by HR/ Admin, Employees will be automatically notified with an Email.

question: How to see all the pending activities count in the on-boarding Module? /Can I view all the pending activities of an Employees during Onboarding?
answer: Yes, click on the onboarding menu and then on the Employee onboarding submenu. In Pending On -Boarded Tab, all the pending information Will be visible in the on-boarding status column. To view it in more details, click on the proceed button and then clicking on Upload Files and policies tab, detailed information can be viewed.

question: Will TalenTicks calculate annual leave balances if Employee join mid-month/year?
answer: Yes, TalenTicks can do the calculation of leave on pro-rata basis based on the leave rule set in the leave rules.

question: How do I check the Summary of all the leave counts of all Active employees?
answer: In Leave & Attendance Menu, click on Leave Dashboard. Select Active Tab and search Employee using the Filter option available. Click on the i button to view the Leave Stats of an Employee.

question: Where can I see all the leave requests sent by an Active Employees?
answer: Click on the Leave & Attendance menu and then on the Authorize leave submenu. Click on Active Employees Tab. Here you can see all the leave requests sent by Employees. You can also search for an employee using the filters available. Status Column shows all the Pending, approved, Rejected and cancelled leave status.

question: As a HR, can I take actions on leave requests of an employees if pending from manager side?
answer: Yes, Click on Authorize Leave submenu under the Leave & Attendance menu. In Active Tab, all the Leave Requests along with their status will be visible.  Using the options for Approve, Reject and Cancel available in Action column, any action on the leaves can be taken.

question: How to reject or cancel leave requests?
answer: Click on the Authorize Leave submenu under the Leave & Attendance menu. Click on the cross icon in the Action Column in the respective row to Reject a particular leave and click on the minus icon in the Action Column in the respective row to cancel a particular leave request. Bulk Reject can also be done, just click on the checkbox present before employee code and click on Bulk Reject to Reject all the selected records all at once.

question: Why is the Reason for Leave showing blank for a leave Request of an Employee?
answer: Reason for Leave shows Blank if HR has directly Uploaded the Leave for the Employee via Bulk Upload Sheet and it’s not actually applied by the employee himself/herself on TalenTicks HRMS through Biometric or Check in/ Checkout option available.

question: What should I do if I want to Reject/ Cancel pre-approved leave Request?
answer: Click on the Authorize Leave submenu under the Leave & Attendance menu. Click on the cross button available in the action column to Reject and click on the minus icon to Cancel the leave request in Action Column. Bulk Reject can also be done, just click on the checkbox present before employee code and click on Bulk Reject button to Reject all the selected records all in one go.

question: Can I multi-select the Leave Requests and do Bulk Reject?
answer: Yes, click on the Authorize Leave submenu in the Leave & Attendance Menu in the Sidebar. A list of applied leaves by all active employees will be seen in Active Employees Tab. Click on the checkbox present before employee code and click on Bulk Reject button to Reject all the selected records all in one go.

question: Can I multi-select the Leave Requests and do Bulk Approve?
answer: Yes, Click on Approve/ Reject Leave submenu in the Leave & Attendance Menu in the Sidebar. A list of applied leaves by all Active Employees will be seen in Active Employees Tab. Click on the checkbox present before employee code and click on Bulk Approve button to Approve all the selected records all in one go.

question: From where I can configure the Payroll Cycle?
answer: Click on the Payroll Setting submenu under the ORG Setting menu, click on “Which day did the pay period:” and select the date of your pay cycle using the drop-down. (If the payroll cycle is 1 to 30, then mention last date. If the payroll cycle is like 20 April to 19 may, then mention start date). And click on Save button.  To check the Payroll Cycle, click on Payroll menu and then on Calculate. Here, below the selected Month Payroll you can check the Payroll Cycle.

question: Want to change the Cut-off Date for Leave & Attendance Regularization?
answer: Click on the Payroll Setting submenu under the ORG Setting menu. Select Days in Cut-off Date for Leave & Attendance Regularization: from the dropdown. The number of days you select, the employee will have the permission to mark leave and regularize for more selected days from the end Date of the pay cycle.

question: Can I change the Cutoff Date days every month?
answer: Yes, click on the payroll setting submenu in ORG setting menu. You can change the cutoff date day but you have to change date before the pay cycle date passes.

question: What if I don’t want to calculate TDS for all employees?
answer: In the ORG Setting menu, click on Payroll Setting submenu.  For Calculate TDS option, select “NO” to disable the calculation of TDS for all employees. And click on Save button.

question: What if in Payroll Setting Menu, the Reimbursement Expense to be included in Payroll: is set as NO?
answer: The Reimbursement Amount sent by an Employee won’t be reflected in the Monthly Pay Calculation.

question: How to open the window for Investment Declaration Proof Submission?
answer: Click on the ORG Setting Menu, click on the Payroll Setting.  In My Financial Setting tab, search for IT declaration Proof Submission field and select from and to date along with the month and click on Save button.

question: From where to Enable or Disable PF and ESIC status for all Employees?
answer: In ORG Setting Menu, click on Payroll Setting and then on PF and ESI tab. Here you can Enable or Disable PF and ESIC status using the enable and disable slider present after the PF and ESI. And click on Save to save the changes.

question: As an HR/Admin, how to View and Edit Old and New Regime Tax Slab details?
answer: Click on the ORG Setting menu, click on the Payroll Setting submenu and then on the Tax slab tab. Here you can view all the tax slab in below data table. You can edit each tax slab by click on the edit button in action column. Enter Tax percentage, effective date and range of the slab with its status and click on Update button to update the changes.

question: What should I do if I want to change the Name of Investment Declaration section name and its limits?
answer: Click on the Payroll Setting submenu under the ORG Setting Menu, and then on the Investment Declaration tab. Here all the sections are displayed in the below data tab. Click on edit button in the action column to edit the details of Investment Declaration sections. You can change the Investment name, maximum limit and choose for which tax regime this section is. and click on Update.

question: How to see which components value is considered for PF calculation?
answer: Click on the ORG Setting Menu and then on the Salary Setting submenu. In the Recurring Components table, search for the component name and in column - Is Incl PF: Yes/No for each component. If the component is showing Yes then it will be included for PF calculation during Salary processing.

question: From where I can see all the created salary Structure Details?
answer: In ORG Setting Menu, click on the Salary Setting and then on the Salary Structure tab. Here, you can see all the already created salary Structure Details in the below data tab with salary structure name and their minimum and maximum range and click on action button to view Salary structure in detail.

question: Where I can see all the created Salary Grade Band Mapping?
answer: In the ORG Setting Menu, click on the Salary Setting submenu and then on Salary Grade Band Mapping tab. You can view all the created Salary Grade Band Mapping in the below data table with grade and band details with their Salary structure and status.

question: Want to view the Attendance Penalty Rule?
answer: Click on the ORG Setting Menu and on the Attendance Penalty Rule submenu. You can view all the Penalty criteria like Unauthorized absence, Half day minimum hours, Full day minimum hours, In-Time and Out-time criteria and their deduction configuration with their status and Rule run date.

question: How to update the Penalty Rule?
answer:
Click on the ORG Setting Menu and on the Attendance Penalty Rule submenu. You can update the leave count mentioned for deduct option and type of penalty to be deducted with the penalty type status and run date.

Where I can see the Penalty Rule Run date? Click on the Attendance Penalty Rule submenu under the ORG Setting Menu. Scroll down to the bottom of the page. The Penalty rule run date field is present below in-time criteria.  Here the date mentioned for Rule Run Date is the date on which the penalty for that month runs.

question: Can I change the penalty Run Date Every Month? If yes, how?
answer: Yes, you can change it every month but before the date actually comes.  Click on the Attendance Penalty Rule submenu under the ORG Setting Menu. Scroll down to the bottom of the page to view Penalty rule run date field. The penalty run date should be always kept after last date of the pay cycle.

question: As an HR, from where I can change the mandatory information tab to be filled in Profile page?
answer: Click on the ORG Setting menu and then on Profile maker config submenu. Here you can choose which tabs to be kept mandatory for an employee to be filled during the Onboarding Process and click on Update button.

question: From where I can Create/edit Company details?
answer: Click on the ORG Setting menu and then on the Organisation submenu. To create a company, click on the Add company button and fill in all the mandatory information and click on Submit. And if you want to Edit the details, click on the edit button available before the company name and change the data and click on Submit.

question: Want to change the Shift Time of General Shift?
answer: Click on the ORG Setting menu and then on the Organisation submenu. Click on the edit button available before the company name. Change the Check In time and Check out time, half day hours and full day hours as needed. Once entered the time, click on Submit button.

question: What should I do if I want to Enable or disable Birthdays and Anniversary data to be displayed on the Dashboard Calendar?
answer: Click on the ORG Setting menu and on the Organisation submenu. Click on the edit button available before the company name. Search the field for Dashboard Calendar and tick or untick the checkbox to enable or disable birthdays and Anniversary. Click on Submit to submit it.

question: How can I change the existing date format if I want to? / Can I change the date format to be viewed into the Talenticks?
answer:
Yes, click on the ORG Setting menu and on the Organisation submenu. Click on the edit button available before the company name. Scroll down and select the date format available in the dropdown of Date Format and click on Submit to submit.

Date formats are explained below:
(dd-mm-yyyy: 10-05-2023)
(dd-MM-yyyy: 10-MAY-2023)

question: Want to see all the branches added in the system?
answer: In ORG Setting menu and then on the Organisation submenu and click on the Branch Tab. The list of branches added in the system along with their Company Name will be displayed in the below data table. You can edit or delete branches using the edit and delete button in the action column.

question: Want to add a new branch? What should I do? / How to add New Branch?
answer: In ORG Setting menu, click on the Organisation submenu and then on the Branch Tab. Click on “Add new” button to add a new branch in the system. Fill in the details like branch name, time zone, address, etc and select whether you want keep the check in, check out button enabled for this branch. Click on Save button.

question: Want to disable the check in/check out button for a Particular Branch?
answer: Click on the ORG Setting menu and then on the Organisation submenu and click on the Branch Tab. Click on the Edit button in the action column to edit the branch details and select “No” for check in, check out allowed for this branch and click on Update to save the data.

question: Want to see all the Grade and Bands Data added into the system?
answer: In the ORG Setting menu and then on the Organisation submenu and click on the Bands tab to view list of bands added into the system.  You can edit and delete the band using the edit and delete button present in the action column. Click on the Pay Grades to view list of grades added into the system with its range. You can edit the grade details using the edit button in the edit column.

question: How to add New Salary structure?
answer: In the ORG Setting menu and then on the Organisation submenu. In Salary Structure tab enter the salary structure name and its ranges, scroll down and mention the percentage for which the annual calculation should be done and click on Save button. Add row using the add row button. List of already added salary structure can be viewed in the below data table. Use the edit icon to edit the structure and you can also search salary structure using the filter.

question: How to check and download an Employee’s Payslip for Payroll Finalized months?
answer:
Click on the Payroll menu and click on the Calculate submenu. Select the company, pay type and then select the Payroll pre-processed Month and click on the View Pay Register and a list of employee’s names will be displayed. Click on the Employee Code to view the payslip and you can also Download it by using the download button.
(Payroll ? Calculate? Select Month? Click on View Pay Register ? Click on Employee Code? Download)

question: Shall I Recalculate the Payroll every time I make changes in data? If yes, how?
answer: o	Yes, it is mandatory to recalculate the payroll so that changes get reflected in the payroll calculation. In Payroll menu click on calculate submenu. Scroll down and click on Recalculate button to recalculate payroll then Select the company, pay type and then the month for which you want to process payroll. Scroll down and click on the Processing tab present for each row after viewing the data using the view button one by one. Once all the processing tab gets processed and displayed in green colour, click on Calculate so that you can get all the changes reflected in the Payroll Calculations. Click on Pay Register button and then on Export Sheet with Leave & Salary Breakup tab.

question: Is it possible to Overwrite TDS Amount individually for an employee? / What should I do to Overwrite the TDS Amount for an Employee?
answer:
Yes, you can overwrite the TDS Amount by clicking on Calculate submenu under Payroll menu. TDS overwrite can be only done once the payroll for that month gets finalized. Select the company, pay type and then the month for which you want to overwrite the TDS for. Scroll down and click on the View Pay register button. Then click on TDS overwrite button present on the top right corner of the page. Select employee using the drop down and enter the TDS overwrite amount in the popup page. Click on the Submit button to submit and the amount will be reflected in the Salary register sheet.

In Payroll, click on Calculate submenu. Select Month and Process the Payroll and Click on Calculate. TDS overwrite can be done once the payroll for that month gets finalized. So, once the payroll gets finalize click on Pay Register and then on TDS Overwrite tab. Select Employee and enter the TDS amount that need to be update and click on submit button. The updated amount will be reflected in Payslip and Pay Register Sheet.

question: How can I make an Employees monthly Salary as 0?
answer: In the Payroll menu, click on the Calculate submenu. Select the company, pay type and then the month for which you want to make Salary zero for an employee. Once the Payroll for that month gets finalized and click on View Pay Register button.  Click on the Make Salary Zero button present and select the employee from the dropdown and click on Submit button. To check, download the Export Sheet with the Leave & Salary Breakup or can check in the payslip of an Employee.

question: From where I can download the Bank Instruction Sheet?
answer: In the Payroll menu, click on the Calculate submenu. Select the Company, pay type and Month for which you want to download the bank instruction sheet. Scroll down and click on View Pay Register. Click on the Export Bank Instruction Sheet button present to download the Bank Instruction Sheet.

question: How can I get to know the names of Employees whose Payroll is still unprocessed? / How to see the Unprocessed Payroll Employee’s List?
answer: Click on the Payroll menu and click on the Calculate submenu. Select the Company, pay type and the Month for which you want to know the details. Scroll down and click on View Pay Register button.  Click on the UNPROCESSED Payroll tab and the list of Employees with unprocessed payroll will be displayed.

question: While processing the monthly Payroll, why the active Employees / New Joinees are showing in Unprocessed Payroll list?
answer:
There might be many reasons for a Employees name shown in the UNPROCESSED PAYROLL tab which are given below:

Employee's Salary is kept on Hold. 
Bank Details are missing in the system 
Payroll Status for the particular employee has been disabled 
Salary Structure not added for that employee.
Check the Date of Joining for New Employee, it should be in Pay Cycle for that month.

question: How to check the Data uploaded through the Issuance Sheet?
answer: Click on the Issuance submenu under the payroll menu. In the Issuance Entries section, all the data uploaded through issuance will be visible.  Use filters to search the data for a particular Employee.

question: What should I do if an Incorrect amount has been uploaded through Issuance?
answer: Click on the Issuance submenu under the payroll menu. In the Issuance Entries section, all the data uploaded through Issuance will be visible. To delete an incorrect amount, click on the delete button available in the Action column and re-upload the Issuance sheet with the correct data.

question: How can I view TDS Calculation page for Employees?
answer: Click on the TDS Calculation submenu under the Payroll Menu. Select the Company, pay type and month for which you want to check the calculation. TDS calculation for all employees will be visible. Search the Employee and click on the View button to view the TDS calculation in detail. Click on the download button in the Download PDF Column to download TDS calculation page.

question: Why the Reimbursement Expense data is not reflected in the monthly Pay Register sheet.
answer: In ORG Setting menu, click on Payroll menu and check whether the field Reimbursement Expense to be included in Payroll: is selected to yes or not. If you want reimbursement data to be calculated then this field should be selected as yes and if it is selected as No then select it to Yes and click on the Save button to update the changes.

question: What process should I follow to do the EXIT Process?
answer:
Hold Employee Salary in the month from which you don’t want to give salary. 
Click on the Exit Process menu and then from HR Exit Process submenu, click on Initiate Exit Process and select Employee. (Employee will be visible in the list only if Employee is on-boarded in the system.) (Refer On- boarding section if any query)
Fill the Exit Process Form. (Date of Relieving should be the Last working date of an Employee)
Add HR/ Manager Remarks
Fill the Due Clearance Form
Close the Interview 
Initiate FnF Process (FnF will be done by HR Payroll Team)

question: What is the very first step to do before initiating the Exit Process?
answer: You need to Hold the Salary of an employee. Click on the Employee Management menu from the Sidebar and click on View Employee tab then Search Employee using the given filters. Click on the hamburger lines available next to the employee code and click on Hold Salary.  Enter the reason for holding the salary. Hold date will be auto-populated as the current date and click on the Submit button. Hold Salary Employee will be visible in the UNPROCESSED PAYROLL list during Payroll and Attendance will be visible in the Hold Employees tab in the attendance menu.

question: What date range is shown in the Full and Final Settlement Process PART II (Salary Information).
answer: The date in Full and Final Settlement Process PART II (Salary Information) shows From Date as the Hold Month Start Date and To Date as the date of Relieving.

question: From where I can get to see the LWP days count of an Employee in FnF?
answer: Click on the Exit Process menu and then on the HR exit process submenu. Click on the Hamburger lines in the action column and click on Full & Final Settlement. In the Part II Salary Information tab, click on the VIEW LEAVE button present on the right screen. LWP Records along with the Date and Count is shown. The Salary Calculated in Part II Salary Information will be calculated based on the LWP Count.

question: How to give some additional amount other than the Salary Structure during FnF?
answer: In the Exit Process menu, click on HR exit process submenu. Click on the Hamburger lines in the action column and then on Full & Final Settlement. In the PART IV(Other Payments), click on Add Particulars button. Enter the name that needs to be displayed in FnF letter in the Earning Part and enter the Amount and select whether it is Taxable or not. Click on save and continue to proceed further.

question: How to add some deduction amount other than the Salary Structure during FnF?
answer: In the Exit Process menu, click on the HR exit process submenu. Click on the Hamburger lines in the action column and click on Full & Final Settlement. In the PART VII(Other deductions/penalties/loan), click on the Add Penalties button. Enter the name that needs to be displayed in the FnF letter in the Deduction Part and enter the Amount. Click on save & continue to proceed further.

question: Can I add Investments Proof for the Employee if the FnF process is closed? / How to add Investment Declaration Proof amount for an Employee in FnF?
answer: Yes, once the FnF process is closed before final submission (Click on the Hamburger present in the action column and click on FNF Proof Submission Option) and fill in the investment for each section in the Proof amount column. Once all VIII Parts of FnF gets processed and before final submit, search Employee in the Exit Process Page. Click on the three lines in the action column and click on the FNF Proof Submission option. Enter the amount in the Proof Amount Column and click on Update Declared Amount. Again, select the FNF Settlement option then click on the Income Tax Calculation tab, check the declared amount and click on save & continue.

question: Can I change the Relieving date? How?
answer: Yes, you can change the date of relieving but you have to change it before the final Closure to the Exit process. To edit it click on the Exit Process menu and then on the HR exit process submenu. Click on the Hamburger lines in the action column and click on Edit button. Change the Relieving date and click on Submit button to update the data.

question: How can I change Due Clearance Questions?
answer: In the Master Menu, click on the Due Clearance Questions submenu. All the due clearance questions can be viewed in the below data table. Click on Edit button to edit the Due Clearance Question and then on the Update button to save the changes. All the questions will get updated in exit process due clearance for that particular role.

question: How To fill Due Clearance as HR?
answer: Click on the HR Exit Process submenu under the Exit Process menu. Click on the Hamburger line and then on Due Clearance. Tick the options in the due clearance form with comments if required for each question. Click on Submit to submit the due clearance form. If you keep any of the questions on hold then the exit process for an employee won’t procced further.

question: From where Can I get the Monthly PT Report?
answer: Click on the Reports Menu and then on the PT Report submenu. Select the company, pay type and payroll month from the drop-down. After this the Excel Report will get downloaded. PT Report can be downloaded only for the processed payroll months. The report will get downloaded in excel format.

question: Want to check monthly PF Report?
answer: Click on Reports Menu and then on PF Report submenu. Select the company, pay type, employee type, Payroll month - year and select columns as needed. Click on the download button to download the PF Report. PF Report can be downloaded only for the processed payroll months. The report will get downloaded in excel format.

question: Can I get PF Reports for Active/Inactive Employees Individually?
answer: Yes, Click on Reports Menu and then on PF Report submenu. Select the company, pay type, select employee type as Active / Inactive, Payroll month - year and select columns as needed. Click on the download button to download the PF Report. Report for selected Employee Type will get downloaded.

question: Can I get Quarterly/Annually TDS Report?
answer: Yes, click on Reports menu and then on TDS Report submenu. Select the company, pay type, select employee type, choose the financial month and select Payroll Quarter for which you want to download the TDS Report. Once selected all the data from the dropdown, TDS Report will get download. Report for selected Employee Type will get downloaded. . TDS Report can be downloaded only for the processed payroll months. The report will get downloaded in excel format.

question: How can I download the ESIC Report?
answer: Click on the Reports menu and then on the ESIC Report submenu. Select Company, Pay type, Payroll month-year and Columns as required and click on the download button available to download the report. The report will get downloaded in excel format.

question: How can I download MLWF Report?
answer: Click on the Reports menu and then on MLWF Report. Select Company, Pay type, Payroll month-year and Columns as required and click on the download button available to download the report. The report will get downloaded in Excel format.

question: Can I get all the Leave and Attendance and Penalty data of all active Employees at one place?
answer: Yes, In the Reports menu, click on Export Leave & Attendance Data. Select filters like date range, company name, branch, Employee name as required and click on Download button and the Excel Sheet with Leave, attendance, penalty and shift data will get downloaded in Excel format. Penalty data will get downloaded only when the actual penalty cron runs otherwise it shows blank.

question: Can I get all the Employees Master Data from the TalenTicks?
answer: Yes, in the Reports menu click on Export Employee Data. Select filters as required and click on the download button. Based on the selected filters for Company, Branch, designation, department, work type and Employee status data will get downloaded in excel format.

question: Can I get Monthly Attendance data in Absent (A) and Present (P) Format?
answer: Yes, go to the Reports Menu and click on Export Attendance Data submenu. Select the filter as needed and click on the download button. Excel Report will get downloaded based on the selected filters.

question: Is there a way to set week off for Employees instead of using Bulk Upload?
answer: Yes, you can do manual selection through Off Days submenu under Leave Configuration menu. Select Company Name, Branch, Select Employee, Month, select week off as needed and click on Submit. Week off will be reflected on Employees dashboard calendar. HR can check the uploaded week off in the Attendance Records.

question: From where to Update the Leave Rule? / What should I do to make on changes in Leave Rules? / From where I can make changes in Leave Rules?
answer: Click on the Leave Configuration menu and on the Leave Rules submenu. In the Leave Rule Configuration List, all the Active and Inactive Leave Rules can be viewed. Click on the Edit button to edit the Leave Rule. Make changes in the edit page and click on update button.

question: What should I do to add a new Leave Rule?
answer: First Create the leave type name using the Leave Type submenu under the Masters menu. Click on the Leave Configuration menu and on the Leave Rules submenu. Select leave type and fill in all the details and click on Create New Configuration. The newly added leave configuration will be displayed in the below Leave Rule Configuration List.

question: Can I check the Penalty Data for Employees before Actual Penalty Date?
answer: Yes, Click on the Attendance Penalty submenu under leave configuration menu. Then select Active Employees tab to view data of Active Employees and on Hold Employees tab to check for penalty for Employees whose salary is on Hold. You can download the sheet by clicking on Excel option.

question: Does the Penalty run by HR side will reflect on Employees Side?
answer: No, it will be for HR Reference only.

question: Want to check all the Designation added or add a new one? /How to add edit designation details?
answer: In the Master menu click on Designation submenu. List of already added designations along with the status and whether to consider for welfare fund or not will be viewed in View & Edit Designation Section along with their status as Active or Inactive. To edit the designation, click on Name, Status and to be consider for welfare fund use the edit button. Click on delete icon to delete the designation. New Designation can be added via Add New Designation section. Enter the Designation Name, click on yes or no for to be consider for labour welfare fund or not and click on submit. New designation will be added with status as active.

question: Want to check, the reason why the MLWF amount is not deducted for a certain designation.
answer: In the Master menu, click on Designation submenu. List of already added designations along with the status and whether to be considered for welfare fund or not will be viewed in View & Edit Designation Section along with their status as Active or Inactive.  Search the designation using filter and check for the column, consider for labour welfare fund is selected to Yes or no. If it is selected to Yes, then only the MLWF amount be deducted. To make it Yes, edit the designation and select consider for labour welfare fund as Yes and Update. Do remember MLWF is deducted twice a year i.e. in the month of June and December.

question: How to create/edit department details?
answer: In the Master menu click on the Department submenu. List of already added departments will be viewed in View & Edit Department Section along with their status as Active or Inactive. Click on edit button to edit the department Name and Status. Click on the delete icon to delete the department. New Department can be added via Add New Department section. Enter the Department Name and click on submit. New department will be added with status as active.

question: How to create/edit Bank name details?
answer:
In the Master menu click on the Bank submenu. 
List of already added bank names along with their status as Active or Inactive will be viewed in the View & Edit Bank Section. To edit the Bank Name and Status use the edit button. Click on the delete icon to delete the bank. New Bank can be added via Add New Bank section. Enter the Bank Name and click on submit. New bank will be added with status as active.

question: How to create/edit sub-vertical details?
answer: In the Master menu click on the Sub-vertical submenu. A list of already added sub-verticals along with their status as Active or Inactive will be viewed in the View & Edit Sub-vertical Section. To edit the sub-vertical Name, vertical name and Status use the edit button. Click on the delete icon to delete the sub-vertical. New Sub-vertical can be added via Add New Sub-vertical section. Enter the Sub-vertical Name, the vertical name list will be populated as added in vertical Master and click on submit. New sub-vertical will be added with status as active.

question: How to create/edit vertical details?
answer:
In the Master menu click on the Vertical submenu. 
List of already added verticals along with their status as Active or Inactive will be viewed in View & Edit Vertical Section. To edit the vertical Name and Status use the edit button. Click on the delete icon to delete the vertical. New Vertical can be added via Add New Vertical section. Enter the Vertical Name and click on submit. New vertical will be added with status as active.

question: How to create/edit zone details?
answer:
In the Master menu click on the Zone submenu. 
A list of already added zones along with their status as Active or Inactive will be viewed in the View & Edit Zone Section. To edit the Zone Name and Status use the edit button. Click on the delete icon to delete the zone. New Zone can be added via Add New Zone section. Enter the Zone Name and click on submit. New zone will be added with status as active.

question: How to create/edit categories in the reimbursement expense master?
answer: In the master’s menu, click on the reimbursement expense submenu. Click on the Category tab. Fill in the category name and select the icon in the icon drop down also enter the description and Click on Submit. The list of already added categories can be viewed in the below data table. You can search them using the filter and edit using the edit button and can be deleted using the delete icon. All the Active category will be visible to the Employee in category list during Reimbursement process.

question: How to create/edit sub-categories in the reimbursement expense master?
answer:
In the Master menu click on the reimbursement expense submenu and then on Sub Categories tab. 
List of already added subcategory will be viewed along with their category and status as Active or Inactive in the below data table. Use edit option to edit the sub category Name, category name and Status. Click on the delete icon to delete the sub menu. New Sub category can be added. Enter the Sub category Name, category name and click on submit. New sub category will be added with status as active.

question: How to do grade mapping in the reimbursement expense master?
answer:
In the master’s menu, click on the reimbursement expense submenu. Click on the Grade Mapping tab. Select the grade using the grade drop down and category that needs to be mapped with Grade from the category drop down.
Select Travel type as local or outside within India type or Travel outside India. 
 If is local or outside within India travel type is selected then choose grade mapping local whether you want to configure it for kilometre-wise or bill wise or daily allowance. If selected kilometre wise then fill in the max kilometres in the max kilometres field. And if selected bill wise then fill in the max amount in the max amount field. And if selected daily allowances then fill in the max amount for daily allowances in the daily allowances field.

 If Travel outside India is selected then choose grade mapping outside whether you want to configure for bill wise or daily allowance. If selected bill wise then fill in the maximum dollars in the max USD field. And if Daily Allowance is selected then fill in the maximum dollars in the max USD field. You can search them using the filter as well as edit and delete the grade mapping using the edit and delete button present in the edit and delete column.
All the added grade mapping can be viewed in the below data table. You can search them using the filter and edit and delete the grade mapping using the edit and delete button present in the edit and delete column.

question: How to create/edit Holiday list?
answer:
In the master’s menu, click on the Holiday submenu. Holidays can be added via single entry and bulk upload option. For Bulk upload, click on Download Format option and Excel sheet for Holiday bulk upload will get downloaded. Fill in all the holiday details in mentioned format and upload it using the choose file option. Then click on the Upload file button.
Single entry can be done in Add New Holiday Section. Select the company, branch, enter holiday name, select date and Holiday Type and click on submit button. All the added holiday can be viewed in the below view & edit holiday data table. You can search them using the filter and edit using the edit icon. You can also delete the holidays using the icon.

question: How to create/edit Leave type in master?
answer: In the Master menu, click on the leave type submenu.  New leave type can be created in Add new Leave Type section. Enter the leave type and a short name and click on the Submit. A list of already added leave type can be viewed in the below view & edit leave type section. You can edit and delete the leave type using the edit and delete icon. Date for the created leave type will also display in the date column and is non editable.

question: How to create/edit Professional Tax data?
answer: In the master’s menu, click on the Professional Tax submenu. In add new PT section, select state, gender, enter minimum amount and maximum amount and amount to be deducted in amount field and PT amount to be deducted in Feb and click on submit. List of already added Professional Tax can be viewed in the below view & edit Professional Tax section. You can search for state name using the filters. Click on Edit button and edit the data that needs to be updated and click on Update button.

question: How can I add new Loan type in the system?
answer:
In Master menu, click on Loan Master submenu.
List of already added loan type details will be viewed in the below data table. You can search loan type using the filter available. You can add new loan configuration using the Add loan configuration section. Just enter the name of loan type in Add Loan Configuration section. Click on Loan type, maximum loan amount limit, work type of employee for which the loan can be applied with the minimum number of months to be completed by the employee, rate of interest changed by market as well as the rate of interest charged by the organisation and click on submit. All the added loan type can be view in the below data table.

question: How to add car perk details?
answer: In the Master menu, click on the Car Perk submenu. You can search the car perk details using the filter available. To add car perk details, enter the value that is less than of the car engine capacity and which is greater than of the car engine capacity with the car expense amount, driver expense amount,	 car expense amount for greater than and the value for taxable driver expense amount and click on Submit. A list of already added car perk details can be viewed in the below data table. Click on the Edit option to edit the details in the already added car perk.

question: How to add/edit the Notice period details?
answer: In the Master menu, click on the Notice Period submenu. To add the Notice Period, select the work type with employee type whether it is for employee who is on probation or after confirmation and the duration of month of notice period and click on Submit. Or work type as permanent also select Employee type. List of already Notice Period can be viewed in the view & notice period section. You can edit it using the edit option available.
